ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Psalm cures
ygData.msgSnippet: For anyone who doesn t know, Rokenn is right about how poisons work.  Meaning, poisons do have counters .  Poisons have a counter system, meaning the weakest
ygData.messageBody:
For anyone who doesn't know, Rokenn is right about how poisons work. Meaning, poisons do have "counters". Poisons have a counter system, meaning the weakest poison will have 1 counter, and the strongest may have 10 (I don't know what the actual numbers are), and that any given cure poison type spell will remove a certain number of those counters. I *belive* in the spdat file it lists what poisons and what cures have what effect. *Shrug*. I think the same is true for disease, but am not completely sure.

Ueni
----- Original Message -----
From: Reeves, Patrick W
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2000 4:02 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Psalm cures


The cure pulses are totaly random. I have a feeling they either remove a
random number of 'counters' or have a percentage chance of removing
disease/poison based how tough the affliction is. As I have had things
like Deadly Poison & Strong Disease removed at times with a single cure
pulse and other times not be cured after 4 or more cure pulses (at that time
I just ask the cleric for a cure).

Rokenn

> I have been seeing the following message when I play Psalm of Purity.
> The wording is from memory, but is close:
>
> Your affliction has been cured by a magical enchantment.
>
> This is great, but oddly I didn't have an affliction at the time ;P.
> A party member said he was cured of boiling blood by my song (Lava
> duct crawlers, Sol B).
>
> Other experience?
>
>
> Maravana Vireo
> 53 Bard of Jus Divinum
> Mithaniel Marr
